alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:59AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis, northern Carlton, southwestern Lake and northwestern Douglas Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 457 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eveleth, to 6 miles southwest of Cotton, to near Brookston, to near Cromwell, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cotton and Canyon around 505 AM CDT. Saginaw around 510 AM CDT. Mahtowa and Fond Du Lac Band Brookston Area around 515 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cloquet, Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area, Pike Lake Near Duluth, Boulder Lake, Whiteface Reservoir, Hermantown, Scanlon, Carlton, Wrenshall, Island Lake, Oliver, Thomson, Fairbanks and City of Rice Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
